title: Loke: MOT supports Westports Malaysia 2 expansion project
summary: The Ministry of Transport (MOT) fully supports Westports Holdings Bhd’s (KL:WPRTS) expansion project in Port Klang known as Westports Malaysia 2.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 22): The Ministry of Transport (MOT) fully supports Westports Holdings Bhd’s (KL:WPRTS) expansion project in Port Klang known as Westports Malaysia 2.

Transport Minister Anthony Loke Siew Fook said a new concession agreement for Westports had been approved by the Cabinet, following an evaluation by the Public Private Partnership Unit (UKAS), and the agreement was ratified at the end of last year.

He said the expansion aims to double

title: Joining BRICS will not adversely affect Malaysia's E&E sector, says minister
summary: Malaysia’s plan to join intergovernmental organisation BRICS (Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa) will not adversely impact its electrical and electronics (E&E) sector, said Science, Technology and Innovation Minister Chang Lih Kang.
content:
KULIM (June 22): Malaysia’s plan to join intergovernmental organisation BRICS (Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa) will not adversely impact its electrical and electronics (E&E) sector, said Science, Technology and Innovation Minister Chang Lih Kang.

He said Malaysia is prepared to join the grouping as this is seen as offering numerous benefits to the country, including in terms of research and development in the E&E sector.

title: PTPTN launches loan restructuring campaign with minimum payment of RM300
summary: The National Higher Education Fund Corporation (PTPTN) has launched its first-ever loan restructuring campaign, offering a minimum payment of RM300 to encourage borrowers to settle their arrears.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 22): The National Higher Education Fund Corporation (PTPTN) has launched its first-ever loan restructuring campaign, offering a minimum payment of RM300 to encourage borrowers to settle their arrears.

In a statement on Saturday, PTPTN announced that the two-month campaign, running from June 1 to July 31, is open to all borrowers with arrears, whether they have conventional or ujrah loans.

"Borrowers need to make a minimum of RM300 in overdue p

title: Zafrul: Malaysia set to improve position in IMD's 2025 competitiveness ranking
summary: The government is confident that Malaysia’s position in the International Institute for Management Development's (IMD) World Competitiveness Ranking 2025 will improve from this year, driven by an increase in high-technology product exports.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 22): The government is confident that Malaysia’s position in the International Institute for Management Development's (IMD) World Competitiveness Ranking 2025 will improve from this year, driven by an increase in high-technology product exports.

Investment, Trade and Industry Minister Tengku Datuk Seri Zafrul Abdul Aziz said a reduction in the country’s high-technology exports influenced Malaysia’s lower positioning in the IMD list this year, and this is a short-term situation that

title: Saravanan retains MIC deputy president post for third term
summary:
Unopposed in the party election, Datuk Seri M Saravanan retained the post of the MIC deputy president for the 2024-2027 term.

MIC president Tan Sri SA Vigneswaran announced the results after Saravanan remained the sole nominee for the post, when nominations closed at 1pm on Saturday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 22): Unopposed in the party election, Datuk Seri M Saravanan retained the post of the MIC deputy president for the 2024-2027 term.

MIC president Tan Sri SA Vigneswaran announced the results after Saravanan remained the sole nominee for the post, when nominations closed at 1pm on Saturday.

“As he has the support of the majority from our party, Datuk Seri M Saravanan is once again the deputy president of MIC,” the president told t

title: Exploiting BlackRock issue mere political tactics to create negative perception, says Fahmi
summary: The exploitation by certain parties of BlackRock Inc's purported involvement in the restructuring of Malaysia Airports Holdings Bhd (MAHB) (KL:AIRPORT) are mere political tactics aimed at creating a negative public perception.
content:
NIBONG TEBAL (June 22): The exploitation by certain parties of BlackRock Inc's purported involvement in the restructuring of Malaysia Airports Holdings Bhd (MAHB) (KL:AIRPORT) are mere political tactics aimed at creating a negative public perception.

Criticising these actions, Communications Minister Fahmi Fadzil described them not only as misleading, but also characterised them as a very short-sighted approach capable of undermining national planning.

"Those wh

title: Cabotage policy to be reintroduced in Sarawak to bolster local shipping industry, says Loke
summary:
The cabotage policy will be reintroduced in Sarawak at the request of the Sarawak government, said Transport Minister Anthony Loke Siew Fook. 

He said this policy aims to support the growth of the domestic shipping industry, particularly in Sarawak, due to the high number of shipping companies and shipbuilding activities present in the state.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 22): The cabotage policy will be reintroduced in Sarawak at the request of the Sarawak government, said Transport Minister Anthony Loke Siew Fook. 

He said this policy aims to support the growth of the domestic shipping industry, particularly in Sarawak, due to the high number of shipping companies and shipbuilding activities present in the state.

“At the request of the Sarawak government, we agreed to reinstate the cabotage policy to sup

title: AirAsia X leads among four Malaysia-based airlines for punctuality in May
summary: Medium-haul, low-cost carrier AirAsia X Bhd (KL:AAX) was the most punctual of four Malaysia-based airlines in May, having 88.7% of its international flights departing within 15 minutes of the scheduled departure time, according to latest data by the Malaysian Aviation Commission (Mavcom), the country’s economic aviation regulator.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 22): Medium-haul, low-cost carrier AirAsia X Bhd (KL:AAX) was the most punctual of four Malaysia-based airlines in May, having 88.7% of its international flights departing within 15 minutes of the scheduled departure time, according to latest data by the Malaysian Aviation Commission (Mavcom), the country’s economic aviation regulator.

On-time performance (OTP) was, however, down by a marginal 0.5% over the previous month’s 89.2%.

AAX’s s

title: Lofty dividend payouts expected in FY2024 as financial health improves
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Prominent firms in the electricity and construction sectors, alongside large-cap companies in fuel retailing, telecommunications, and tourism, are poised to offer higher dividends in the financial year 2024 (FY2024).UOB Kay Hian Wealth Advisors head of investment research, Mohd ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Prominent firms in the electricity and construction sectors, alongside large-cap companies in fuel retailing, telecommunications, and tourism, are poised to offer higher dividends in the financial year 2024 (FY2024).

UOB Kay Hian Wealth Advisors head of investment research, Mohd Sedek Jantan, attributed this prospect to improving financial performance and growing confidence.

"An anticipated improvement in dividend distribution signals financial health, with most companies expected to fully recover from the p

title: Straight fight between PH and PN in Sungai Bakap by-election on July 6
summary: The upcoming Sungai Bakap state by-election in Penang will see a straight fight between candidates from Pakatan Harapan (PH) and Perikatan Nasional (PN).

title: Outlook bullish on progress in DNB deal
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Market watchers are bullish about the telecommunications (telco) industry in light of the most recent advancements in the nation's 5G saga.Four major mobile network operators—CelcomDigi Bhd through Infranation Sdn Bhd, Maxis Broadband Sdn Bhd, U ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Market watchers are bullish about the telecommunications (telco) industry in light of the most recent advancements in the nation's 5G saga.

Four major mobile network operators—CelcomDigi Bhd through Infranation Sdn Bhd, Maxis Broadband Sdn Bhd, U Mobile Sdn Bhd, and YTL Communications Sdn Bhd through YTL Power International Bhd—are set to acquire equity stakes in Digital Nasional Berhad (DNB).

title: Greater KL gaining prominence as Asia hub, says InvestKL CEO
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Kuala Lumpur's diverse, multilingual talent pool, robust regulatory frameworks, business-friendly environment, and strong commitment to sustainability are making it increasingly prominent as a highly appealing and accessible hub in Asia, according to InvestKL chief executive officer Datuk ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Kuala Lumpur's diverse, multilingual talent pool, robust regulatory frameworks, business-friendly environment, and strong commitment to sustainability are making it increasingly prominent as a highly appealing and accessible hub in Asia, according to InvestKL chief executive officer Datuk Muhammad Azmi Zulkifli.

He said that the city is gaining recognition as a prime location for global service centers that empower multinational corporations (MNCs) to efficiently serve their customers across Asia in areas suc

title: Agricore closes ACE Market debut day at 87.5 sen
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Agricore CS Holdings Bhd made its debut on the ACE Market of Bursa Malaysia yesterday, trading at 79 sen, which represents a 58 per cent premium over the 50 sen price of its initial public offering (IPO).The food ingredient provider ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Agricore CS Holdings Bhd made its debut on the ACE Market of Bursa Malaysia yesterday, trading at 79 sen, which represents a 58 per cent premium over the 50 sen price of its initial public offering (IPO).

The food ingredient provider has raised RM25.9 million during its IPO, mostly for the purpose of buying RM18.9 million worth of inventory to fuel its expansion.

The company will allocate RM2.7 million to expand storage capacity by setting up a new regional storage facility in Klang, Selangor, to enhance the

title: Nomination for Sungai Bakap by-election closes at 10am
summary:
Nomination for the Sungai Bakap state by-election closed at 10am on Saturday.

Returning officer Khairulnizam Hashim made the announcement at the Jawi Multipurpose Hall, Taman Desa Jawi, here.
content:
NIBONG TEBAL (June 22): Nomination for the Sungai Bakap state by-election closed at 10am on Saturday.

Assistant returning officer Syamsul Fitry Ahmad made the announcement at the Jawi Multipurpose Hall, Taman Desa Jawi, here. 

The Sungai Bakap by-election was called following the death of its incumbent Nor Zamri Latiff, on May 24 due to stomach inflammation.

title: Economists call for equitable benefits as business with China continus to expand
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Trade and investment linkages between Malaysia and China reached another significant milestone recently with the signing of 11 memorandums of understanding involving a potential investment of RM13.2 billion.However, while these economic initiatives must translate into practical projects soonest ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Trade and investment linkages between Malaysia and China reached another significant milestone recently with the signing of 11 memorandums of understanding involving a potential investment of RM13.2 billion.

However, while these economic initiatives must translate into practical projects soonest possible, economists have emphasised that equitable benefits must be ensured for all parties concerned, especially the domestic private sector.

title: Talks with investors for deals worth RM60.4b ongoing, says Mida
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia is anticipated to attract more approved investments from major economies in the upcoming quarters.According to the Malaysian Investment Development Authority (MIDA), it is actively pursuing 1,775 proposed projects worth RM68 billion, comprising 1,709 in the services sector (RM44.7 ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia is anticipated to attract more approved investments from major economies in the upcoming quarters.

According to the Malaysian Investment Development Authority (MIDA), it is actively pursuing 1,775 proposed projects worth RM68 billion, comprising 1,709 in the services sector (RM44.7 billion) and 66 in manufacturing (RM23.3 billion), as of May 31, 2024.

It also said that negotiations are ongoing with prospect investors for high-potential leads totalling RM60.4 billion.

title: Economist: Drop in competitiveness not overnight phenomenon
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia's competitiveness has been on the downtrend for years and is not an overnight phenomenon, says a prominent economist.Prof Tan Sri Noor Azlan Ghazali said the drop in Malaysia's competitiveness ranking was not caused by ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia's competitiveness has been on the downtrend for years and is not an overnight phenomenon, says a prominent economist.

Prof Tan Sri Noor Azlan Ghazali said the drop in Malaysia's competitiveness ranking was not caused by short-term factors including the country's economic performance in the past year, US interest rates or geopolitics.

"This downward trend is the result of the whole country not giving its full commitment to enact change.

summary: Lawmakers will table a pair of bills this week that will facilitate the merger between economic aviation regulator Malaysian Aviation Commission (Mavcom) and its technical counterpart Civil Aviation Authority of Malaysia (CAAM).
content:

title: Nomination opens for Sungai Bakap by-election
summary:
Nomination for the Sungai Bakap state by-election opened at 9am at the Jawi Multipurpose Hall, Taman Desa Jawi, here on Saturday.

The nomination process is expected to last for one hour, concluding at 10am, allowing time for the submission of nomination papers before returning officer Khairulnizam Hashim announces the candidates eligible to contest.
content:
NIBONG TEBAL (June 22): Nomination for the Sungai Bakap state by-election opened at 9am at the Jawi Multipurpose Hall, Taman Desa Jawi, here on Saturday.

The nomination process is expected to last for one hour, concluding at 10am, allowing time for the submission of nomination papers before returning officer Khairulnizam Hashim announces the candidates eligible to contest.

The Sungai Bakap by-election was called

title: Why resilient units in the region remain key to Axiata’s dividend aim
summary: Impatient shareholders are questioning Axiata Group Bhd’s (KL:AXIATA) continued investments abroad. Citing the group’s losses in Nepal, a number of shareholders asked the board of directors and its chief executive officer why the group should continue investing in frontier markets at its recent annual general meeting. At least one suggested that Axiata liquidate its regional portfolio and concentrate investments in Malaysia.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 22): Impatient shareholders are questioning Axiata Group Bhd’s (KL:AXIATA) continued investments abroad. Citing the group’s losses in Nepal, a number of shareholders asked the board of directors and its chief executive officer why the group should continue investing in frontier markets at its recent annual general meeting. At least one suggested that Axiata liquidate its regional portfolio and concentrate investments in Malaysia.

The regional telecommunications group’s CEO Vivek Sood, howeve

title: Oil eases on strong dollar, global economic news
summary: Crude prices eased about 1% on Friday on worries that global oil demand growth could be hit by a strong US dollar and negative economic news from some parts of the world.
content:
Brent futures fell 47 cents, or 0.6%, to settle at US$85.24 a barrel, while US West Texas Intermediate crude (WTI) ended 56 cents, or 0.7%, lower at US$80.73.

NEW YORK: Crude prices eased about 1% on Friday on worries that global oil demand growth could be hit by a strong US dollar and negative economic news from some parts of the world.

Prices declined despite signs of improving US oil demand and falling

title: Wall St Week Ahead: Tech rally may be getting stretched
summary: A blistering rally in US big tech stocks may be due for a breather, offering hope for market segments that have been more tepid this year.
content:
Huge price gains, including Nvidia Corp's 155% year-to-date run, have stirred worries that the tech rally might be overheated. — Bloomberg

NEW YORK: A blistering rally in US big tech stocks may be due for a breather, offering hope for market segments that have been more tepid this year.

title: S&P, Nasdaq end lower as Nvidia drags tech sector
summary: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq closed marginally lower on Friday, weighed down by a decline in Nvidia shares for a second straight day, which dragged down the technology sector.
content:
The Dow rose 15.57 points, or 0.04%, to 39,150.33, the S&P 500 lost 8.55 points, or 0.16%, to 5,464.62 and the Nasdaq lost 32.23 points, or 0.18%, to 17,689.36.

NEW YORK: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq closed marginally lower on Friday, weighed down by a decline in Nvidia shares for a second straight day, which dragged down the technology sector.

title: Unity govt never defended parties collaborating with Israeli regime — Kamil Munim
summary:
The unity government has never defended any party that collaborates with the Israeli Zionist regime, political secretary to the Finance Minister, Muhammad Kamil Abdul Munim said. 

In a statement on Friday, he addressed comments made by former cabinet minister Khairy Jamaluddin, who alleged that BlackRock, a firm purportedly linked to Israel, has taken up stakes in Malaysia Airports Holdings Bhd (MAHB).
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 22): The unity government has never defended any party that collaborates with the Israeli Zionist regime, political secretary to the Finance Minister, Muhammad Kamil Abdul Munim said. 

In a statement on Friday, he addressed comments made by former cabinet minister Khairy Jamaluddin, who alleged that BlackRock, a firm purportedly linked to Israel, has taken up stakes in Malaysia Airports Holdings Bhd (MAHB).

title: Diesel subsidy not withdrawn, now targeted to specific groups — KPDN
summary:
The Domestic Trade and Cost of Living Ministry (KPDN) has clarified that the government has not withdrawn diesel subsidies, but has instead shifted from bulk to targeted subsidies.

KPDN deputy secretary-general (domestic trade development) Datuk Roziah Abudin said that approximately 1.4 million diesel vehicles in Peninsular Malaysia, along with 33 types of public transport and commercial vehicles, are eligible for subsidised diesel.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 21): The Domestic Trade and Cost of Living Ministry (KPDN) has clarified that the government has not withdrawn diesel subsidies, but has instead shifted from bulk to targeted subsidies.

KPDN deputy secretary-general (domestic trade development) Datuk Roziah Abudin said that approximately 1.4 million diesel vehicles in Peninsular Malaysia, along with 33 types of public transport and commercial vehicles, are eligible for subsidised diesel.

title: SG Bakap Polls: Harapan Youth machinery needs to use hybrid approach to counter slander
summary: The Harapan Youth machinery has been urged to use a hybrid approach using both physical and virtual means to counter twisted narratives with facts throughout the campaigning period for the Sungai Bakap by-election that kicks off on Saturday.
content:
NIBONG TEBAL (June 22): The Harapan Youth machinery has been urged to use a hybrid approach using both physical and virtual means to counter twisted narratives with facts throughout the campaigning period for the Sungai Bakap by-election that kicks off on Saturday.

Harapan Youth deputy chief Adam Adli Abdul Halim said the Pakatan Harapan (PH) coalition machinery needs to be a team that moves forward among the community to combat slander and baseless accusations that could weaken the people’s support and trust

title: UMW realigns strategies to promote growth
summary: Mergers and acquisitions (M&As) are recognised as transformative events in the corporate world, reshaping industries, creating synergies, and often sparking significant changes within the companies involved.
content:
MERGERS and acquisitions (M&As) are recognised as transformative events in the corporate world, reshaping industries, creating synergies, and often sparking significant changes within the companies involved.

They can also lead to new opportunities, competitive advantages, and expanded market reach.

title: Winning the digital game
summary: Mr Tan, a 51-year old engineer doesn’t believe in using e-wallet or even shop online. He is pretty much an “old-school” chap. But when his friends started to talk about the ease of opening an account with a digital bank and the attractive rates offered, he decided to sign up.
content:
MR Tan, a 51-year old engineer doesn’t believe in using e-wallet or even shop online. He is pretty much an “old-school” chap. But when his friends started to talk about the ease of opening an account with a digital bank and the attractive rates offered, he decided to sign up.

summary: For the local bourse, the first half of the year has been driven by some key market themes and among them is the data centre theme.
content:
Malaysia has become a hotspot for data centres for a confluence of reasons.

FOR the local bourse, the first half of the year has been driven by some key market themes and among them is the data centre theme.

summary: Digital banks have mushroomed across Asia in recent years.
content:
DIGITAL banks have mushroomed across Asia in recent years.

In South-East Asia, there were plenty of activities in the digital banking scene a few years back, attracting venture capital funds into this red-hot tech sector, which is seen as a potentially lucrative business.

title: CSI Solution ready for all companies to support ESG, boost competitiveness — Bursa Malaysia
summary: Bursa Malaysia Bhd announced the newly launched Centralised Sustainability Intelligence (CSI) Solution is now available for companies of all sizes, from conglomerates to small and medium enterprises (SMEs), both listed and unlisted.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 21): Bursa Malaysia Bhd announced the newly launched Centralised Sustainability Intelligence (CSI) Solution is now available for companies of all sizes, from conglomerates to small and medium enterprises (SMEs), both listed and unlisted.

According to the exchange, the CSI Solution offers a comprehensive framework to help Malaysian companies integrate environmental, social, and governance (ESG) considerations into their business strategies and operations, enhancing overall competitiveness.
